abstract: Op-Ed article by Ford Foundation Pres Darren Walker argues system for awarding prestigious, unpaid internships perpetuates income inequality and should be reformed; asserts many talented underprivileged candidates lack access to elite networks and cannot work for free; calls for organizations to pay interns and draw from more diverse pool of applicants.
snippet: The unpaid internship system advantages those with networks and financial means while others wait at opportunity’s door. Proposals would change that....
lead_paragraph: The unpaid internship system advantages those with networks and financial means while others wait at opportunity’s door. Proposals would change that.
